frameDefinitions: In this frame an Ingestor takes a Substance into his or her body.
An Ingestor consumes food or drink (Ingestibles), which entails putting the Ingestibles in the mouth for delivery to the digestive system.
These are words describing situations in which a Perpetrator takes Goods from a  Victim or a Source.
A Creator creates an artifact that is typically an iconic Representation of an actual or imagined entity or event.
The Self_mover, a living being, moves under its own direction along a Path.
An Agent attempts to achieve a Goal using some Means.
frameExamples: You should refrain from <t>taking</t> vodka up the nose.
I can't believe he <t>pickpocketed</t> my gold watch !
Diagrams must be clearly <t>drawn</t> on construction paper. CNI
She <t>walked</t> along the road for a while.
John <t>tried</t> using a crowbar to open the door.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Delivery_device</fen> is the means by which the <fen>Substance</fen> is ingested.
The <fen>Ingestor</fen> ingests the <fen>Substance</fen>.
The <fen>Substance</fen> is the drug or other substance that is ingested by the <fen>Ingestor</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Ingestor</fen> ingests the <fen>Substance</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Ingestor</fen> ingests the <fen>Substance</fen>.
The <fen>Ingestor</fen> is the person eating or drinking.
The <fen>Ingestibles</fen> are the entities that are being consumed by the <fen>Ingestor</fen>.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
<fen>Perpetrator</fen> is the person (or other agent) that takes the goods away.
<fen>Victim</fen> is the person (or other sentient being or group) that owns the goods before they are taken away by the perpetrator.
<fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor, time, or legal rights) that can be taken away.
<fen>Source</fen> is the initial location of the goods, before they change location.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the theft occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the theft occurs.
An individual or individuals that bring the <fen>Representation</fen> into existence.
The entity that is created to represent either iconically or abstractly.
The time at which a <fen>Representation</fen> is created.
The location in which the <fen>Creator</fen> produces the <fen>Representation</fen>.
<fen>Self_mover</fen> is the living being which moves under its own power. Normally it is expressed as an external argument.

<fen>Source</fen> is used for any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion.
In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion.  With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
<fen>Path</fen> is used for any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen>.  This includes 'middle of path'' expressions.
<fen>Goal</fen> is used for any expression which tells where the <fen>Self_mover</fen> ends up as a result of the motion.

<fen>Area</fen> is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path.  Note that this role should not be used for cases when the same phrase could be used with the same meaning with a non-motion target, since these should be annotated with the <fen>Place</fen> FE.
The direction that the <fen>Self_mover</fen> heads in during the motion.
The time when the motion occurs.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which a defined motion takes place.  Any specified or implied  <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen> should designate a location contained with the <fen>Place</fen>.  This role can be differentiated from <fen>Area</fen> by the fact that the annotated phrase can be used in the same meaning with non-motion targets.
The <fen>Agent</fen> makes an attempt to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to achieve.
This role identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which an attempt occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the attempt occurs.
The place where an attempt is made.
listRoleExamples: Tabitha smoked <fex>a pipe</fex>.
<fex>Leslie</fex> stole the watch from Kim.
Leslie stole the watch <fex>from Kim</fex>.
Leslie STOLE <fex>the watch</fex> from Kim.
Leslie stole the watch <fex>from the table</fex>.
Leslie STOLE the watch from Kim <fex>at dusk</fex>.
Leslie STOLE the watch from Kim <fex>in the park</fex>.
Supposedly, <fex>the artist</fex> drew the picture from memory.

Most of us know where we took <fex>a photo</fex> but have a harder time remembering the time
we took it.
My brother took this picture in France <fex>almost 10 years ago</fex>, and has recently scanned it in.
I took this picture <fex>in Italy</fex> a couple of weeks ago.
<fex>Fred</fex> crawled the narrow passage.
The cat ran <fex>out of the house</fex>.
The scouts hiked <fex>through the desert</fex>.
The children skipped <fex>into the park</fex>.
The mouse scurried <fex>about</fex>.
You should walk <fex>south</fex> about a block .
The hitchhikers walked <fex>in the middle of the road</fex>.
<fex>Dana</fex> tried a crowbar.
John tried using a crowbar <fex>to enter the locked door</fex>.
Dana tried <fex>using a crowbar</fex>.
<fex>On the bridge</fex> he tried the crowbar.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: A Publication of The Historical Research Department
